result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendall K Hamler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant may apply for but may not begin Challenge Incareration or Substance Abuse program until he has served 2 years of Initial Confinement.
Court grants 66 days credit.
09/07/2016 - DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR PROGRAMS BUT CANNOT BE RELEASED BEFORE 2 YEARS.

superMiscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED TO BUY MONEY AND COSTS/DNA SURCHARGE.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Must obtain GED/HSED.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/couseling.
Mental Health/Psycological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns, pubs, or liquor stores)
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

records.addlTxt: from WCTC

Defendant Kendall K Hamler in court, in custody, with Attorney John Paul Marchan.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing.  Parties go through PSI with any corrections/modifications.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Marchan makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following: 

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

8 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 66 days)
  -  3 YEARS  OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS  OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling- must obtain HSED/GED  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
____No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

BUY MONEY:  $360.00 to Metro Drug Unit  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. *after 2 years*
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  *after 2 years* 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant Kendall K Hamler in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in. State will not file any bail jumping charges relating to the Milwaukee Case No.15CF2473. Parties request a separate date for sentencing. Court grants request. Court orders a Presentence Investigation to be compiled and filed within 45 days. Court will set a sentencing date in 60 days. Defense requests bail remain and not be revoked. State responds. Court will revoke bail. Defendant taken into custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
